name: Jude Crener Junior Pierre
biography: I am a PhD candidate at Nara Institute of Science and Technology (NAIST), specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP). My research focuses on applying NLP techniques to medical data, aiming to retrieve meaningful insights and solve societal problems. In my free time, I enjoy reading, listening to music, playing soccer, and watching Japanese anime.

currentProjects.title: Ph.D. research: Data augmentation method using generative AI (LLMs) for low-resources datasets
currentProjects.description: Explore how Generative AI (LLMs) can address data scarcity in medical datasets, focusing on Named Entity Recognition (NER) task.

pastProjects.title: Ph.D. research: Abbreviation Expansion using only a Single Word as Context
pastProjects.description: Accurate interpretation of medical abbreviations is vital for clinical decision-making, as given their frequent ambiguity in medical texts often contain ambiguous   abbreviations. The study proposes a simple Word Sense Disambiguation method that uses a single word to determine the meaning of an ambiguous abbreviation in a sentence and to expand it.

pastProjects.title: Master thesis: Analysis of disease and drug trends in medical research literature using Natural Language Processing (NLP) and time series
pastProjects.description: Large medical abstracts were collected from the PubMed Database, Named Entity Recognition (NER) was applied to the texts to identify the entities (drugs and diseases) and the relationship between them using linear correlation, and further trend analysis was applied using time series.
